title.narrative: SUPPORTING AUTHORITIES FOR ECE&ECI

description.narrative: National and local authorities have evidence, best practices and technical advice on driving legislation, improving financial resourcing and implementing the inclusive ECE and integrated ECI policies for the most vulnerable children., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the Government implements appropriately resourced inclusive early childhood education (ECE) and multisectoral early childhood intervention (ECI) policies at national and subnational levels, with special focus on the most vulnerable children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and local authorities have evidence, best practices and technical advice on driving legislation, improving financialresourcing and implementing the inclusive ECE and integrated ECI policies for the most vulnerable children.

description.narrative: The Ministry of;Education received 1,26 billion HRK (245 million dollars) of the EU Recovery and Resilience facility based on data provided by UNICEF CO for the expansion of the kindergarten network. The funds will be used for building, extending, adapting and equipping kindergartens to get all pre-primary aged boys and girls;into preprimary education by 2027.The Phase 3: Testing the Child Guarantee in Croatia provides a valuable foundation of data analyses and knowledge about ECI services to support the phased development, improvement and expansion of a National ECI System. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022

actual.value: 2021:There has been limited progress in drafting the Strategic Plan for ECI by the High Government Committee for Early Childhood Intervention as pandemics and health care reform is hindering the committee's work and prioritization of ECI.
